chinese: make sb. feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed 安慰；慰藉
examples: e.g. He [[consoled]] himself that he would see Kate again soon.

chinese: 1) become mentally or emotionally strong again after a bad experience, or help sb. to do this （在精神或感情上）（使）复原；（使）坚强起来
examples: e.g. Bianca was the kind of woman who could [[heal]] his soul, if he had time to let her.；e.g. It took a long time for the wounds to [[heal]].

chinese: 2) (also heal up) become healthy again; make sth. healthy again （使）康复，复原
examples: e.g. Bianca was the kind of woman who could [[heal]] his soul, if he had time to let her.；e.g. It took a long time for the wounds to [[heal]].

chinese: [C, U] when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual 巧合；巧事
examples: e.g. I think it is more than [[coincidence]] that all the complaints have come from the same group of people.

chinese: [C, U] a treatment that helps sb. feel better, grow stronger, etc., esp. after an illness 治疗；疗法
examples: e.g. Many patients receiving these new [[therapies]] respond rapidly to them and get a lot of clinical benefit.

chinese: (fml.) suggest sth. as a plan or course of action 提议；建议
examples: e.g. In his speech he [[proposed]] that the UN should set up an emergency center for the environment.

chinese: (usu. before noun) lasting for only a short time 短暂的；飞逝的
examples: e.g. For one [[fleeting]] moment, Paula allowed herself to forget her troubles.

chinese: [C, U] the act of betraying sb. / sth. or the fact of being betrayed 背叛；出卖
examples: e.g. She wondered if he felt hurt at his best friend's [[betrayal]] but didn't have the courage to ask.

chinese: [U] when you are with sb. you enjoy being with, and are not alone 友谊；友好交往
examples: e.g. That feeling of [[companionship]] can make a huge difference, especially at a stressful job.

chinese: [C] a sudden clear understanding of sth. or part of sth., esp. a complicated situation or idea （尤指对复杂情况、看法的）顿悟，猛醒
examples: e.g. The article gives us a real [[insight]] into the causes of the present economic crisis.

chinese: [C] 叙述者；讲述者
[C] (AmE also monolog) a long speech by one person 长篇独白
examples: e.g. Blogs are not just about one person sharing in a [[monologue]] with everyone else listening.

chinese: in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect 自相矛盾地；反常地
examples: e.g. [[Paradoxically]], the economy is improving although many families complain about the poverty in which they live.

chinese: (only before noun) belonging to mental or spiritual life 内心的；精神的
examples: e.g. [[Interior]] monolog is defined as the thoughts you have running through your brain or the things that you silently tell yourself.；e.g. The [[interior]] of the church was dark.

chinese: [C, usu. sing.] the inner part or inside of sth. 内部；里面
examples: e.g. [[Interior]] monolog is defined as the thoughts you have running through your brain or the things that you silently tell yourself.；e.g. The [[interior]] of the church was dark.

chinese: existing everywhere or involving everyone 普遍的；全体的；共同的
examples: e.g. Smiling is apparently a [[universal]] sign of friendliness and approval.

chinese: [U] the quality or state of being universal 普遍性；通用性
examples: e.g. His lyrics aim for a certain timeless [[universality]].

chinese: [U] the quality of not changing as the years go past, or as fashion changes 永恒；不朽
examples: e.g. It is said that all diamonds are symbolic of love, commitment, and [[timelessness]], but adding yellow to the stone gives it even deeper meaning.

chinese: existing in the mind but not immediately available to consciousness 下意识的；潜意识的
examples: e.g. There are conscious thoughts that you're aware of and [[subconscious]] ones that you're not.

chinese: make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc. 缓解；减轻
examples: e.g. The school needs to take some measures to [[ease]] the burden on busy teachers.；e.g. He studied hard every day so that he could pass the exam with [[ease]].

chinese: [U] the fact that sth. is easy to do 容易；轻易；不费劲
examples: e.g. The school needs to take some measures to [[ease]] the burden on busy teachers.；e.g. He studied hard every day so that he could pass the exam with [[ease]].

chinese: (also empathic) having the ability to understand sb. else's feelings or emotions 同情的；共鸣的
examples: e.g. Providing a loving home environment can help the child to become independent, self-confident, and [[empathetic]] toward others.

chinese: 1) a mild illness or health problem is not serious 不严重的；轻微的
examples: e.g. She had a [[mild]] headache, and went to bed much earlier than usual.；e.g. I like this kind of cheese because it has a pleasant [[mild]] flavor.

chinese: 2) not very strong or hot-tasting 不浓烈的；淡的；不辣的
examples: e.g. She had a [[mild]] headache, and went to bed much earlier than usual.；e.g. I like this kind of cheese because it has a pleasant [[mild]] flavor.

chinese: [C] sth. wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness 症状
examples: e.g. Tiredness is one of the most common [[symptoms]] of stress.

chinese: [C] 阅读治疗专家
1) in a way that happens repeatedly 多次重复地；频繁地
examples: e.g. We are [[continually]] reassessing the situation.；e.g. The telephone has been ringing [[continually]] in the office all morning.

chinese: 2) in a way that continues for a long time without stopping 持续地；不间断地
examples: e.g. We are [[continually]] reassessing the situation.；e.g. The telephone has been ringing [[continually]] in the office all morning.

chinese: feel extremely sad, esp. because sb. you love has died （尤指因所爱之人去世而）感到悲痛
examples: e.g. He died, and every day since then I have [[grieved]] for him.

chinese: [C] the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play （书、电影、戏剧的）情节
examples: e.g. Although the cast (全体演员) was different back then, the [[plot]] was strikingly similar.

chinese: fictional people, events, etc. are imaginary and from a book or story 虚构的；编造的；小说（中）的
examples: e.g. He has created many lively [[fictional]] characters with his wonderful writing.

chinese: [C, U] when you stop working, usu. because of your age 退休；退职
examples: e.g. He became a keen golfer after his [[retirement]] from politics.

chinese: (fml.) continuing only for a short time 短暂的；转瞬即逝的；一时的
examples: e.g. The trading data show that these events had minimal and [[transient]] effect on the price of gold and silver.

chinese: [U] the state of continuing only for a short time 短暂；转瞬即逝
examples: e.g. History is a combination of permanence and [[transience]].

chinese: 1) (of a situation) complicated and unpleasant to deal with （状况）棘手的
examples: e.g. If you find yourself in a [[messy]] situation, please take these five strategies to heart.；e.g. Sorry, the place is so [[messy]] because I haven't had time to clear up.

chinese: 2) dirty or untidy 脏的；乱的
examples: e.g. If you find yourself in a [[messy]] situation, please take these five strategies to heart.；e.g. Sorry, the place is so [[messy]] because I haven't had time to clear up.

chinese: [U] extreme sadness, esp. because sb. you love has died 悲痛，极度悲伤（尤指因所爱之人去世）
examples: e.g. The [[grief]] she felt over Helen's death was almost unbearable.

chinese: [U] a feeling that you have no hope at all 绝望
examples: e.g. A few positive words can turn [[despair]] into hope.

chinese: 1) (fml.) a short piece of writing about a person or place that you knew well, or an event that you experienced 传略；实录
examples: e.g. Her [[memoir]] of her friend will be published soon.；e.g. Angelou's first volume of [[memoirs]] dealt with her childhood.

chinese: 2) (~s) [pl.] a book by sb. important and famous in which they write about their life and experiences （名人）回忆录
examples: e.g. Her [[memoir]] of her friend will be published soon.；e.g. Angelou's first volume of [[memoirs]] dealt with her childhood.

chinese: 1) [U] (fml.) the act, process, or skill of telling a story 叙述；叙述技巧
examples: e.g. The novel contains too much dialog and not enough [[narrative]].；e.g. At several points in the [[narrative]] the two stories cross.

chinese: 2) [C] (fml.) a description of events in a story, esp. in a novel （尤指小说中的）叙述，记叙
examples: e.g. The novel contains too much dialog and not enough [[narrative]].；e.g. At several points in the [[narrative]] the two stories cross.

chinese: believing that good things will happen in the future 乐观的；乐观主义的
examples: e.g. Bankers are cautiously [[optimistic]] about the country's economic future.

chinese: (also one after another) if a series of events or actions happen one after the other, each one happens soon after the previous one 一个接一个地；接二连三地
examples: e.g. The children walked silently, [[one after the other]], into the schoolhouse to begin their lesson.

chinese: because you want sth. to happen 抱着···的希望
examples: e.g. Shoppers flocked to the sales in the hope of finding a bargain.

chinese: 米歇尔・德・蒙田 ( 法国作家、哲学家 )
萨塞克斯大学 (英国大学，位于英格兰)
海伦・加纳 （澳大利亚作家）
罗伯特・德塞（澳大利亚作家）
